content.question: The least-squares regression line <math alttext="y hat equals 1.8 minus 0.2 times x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover><mo>⁢</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>1.8</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0.2</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> summarizes the relationship between velocity, in feet per second, and depth, in feet, in measurements taken for a certain river, where <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> represents velocity and <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> represents the depth of the river. What is the predicted value of <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, in feet, when <math alttext="x equals 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>?

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Calculate summary statistics, relative positions of points within a distribution, correlation, and predicted response.
